message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DM

Reasoning: The paper deals with computational complexity and optimization problems related to the Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) of a text, which is a fundamental data structure in string compression. This makes it likely to belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-categories. The paper also makes use of concepts from information theory (such as entropy) and machine learning (such as PTAS and approximation algorithms), which suggests a possible fit with the cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories. Finally, the paper establishes connections between problems on graphs and string compression, which could make it relevant to the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category.
